item.title: Finance
item.description:
This is the list of courses that I have pursued as part of my professional development in the field of finance.

CFA

  • The Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) credential has become the most respected and recognized investment designation in the world. Learn more about CFA program. The CFA Program is organized into three levels, each culminating in a six-hour exam. The program curriculum progresses in complexity as one move through the three levels:

    • Level I: Focuses on a basic knowledge of the ten topic areas and simple analysis using investment tools
    • Level II: Emphasizes application of investment tools and concepts with a focus on valuation of all types of assets
    • Level III: Focuses on synthesizing all of the concepts and analytical methods in a variety of applications for effective portfolio management and wealth planning

Series 3

  • The Series 3 exam is administered by the Financial Industry Regulatory Athority (FINRA) and covers topics such as options, futures, hedging, margin requirements, and regulations. Learn more about Series 3 certification. The Series 3 exam is broken into two parts:
    • 85 questions on market knowledge
    • 35 questions on regulations

item.title: CFA
item.description:
Successfully passed all the three levels of the CFA program.

CFA Certification

  • Level 1 - Passed in July 2010

    • Topics covered:
      • Alternative Investments
      • Corporate Finance
      • Derivatives
      • Economics
      • Equity Investments
      • Ethical and Professional Standards
      • Financial Reporting and Analysis
      • Fixed Income Investments
      • Portfolio Management
      • Quantitative Methods

  • Level 2 - Passed in July 2012 Failed level 2 in July 2011

    • Topics covered:
      • Alternative Investments
      • Corporate Finance
      • Derivatives
      • Economics
      • Equity Investments
      • Ethical and Professional Standards
      • Financial Reporting and Analysis
      • Fixed Income Investments
      • Portfolio Managements
      • Quantative Methods

  • Level 3 - Passed in August 2013.

    • Topics covered:
      • Portfolio Management
      • Equity Investments
      • Economics
      • Fixed Income Investments
      • Risk Management
      • Performance Evaluation
      • Economics
      • Ethical and Professional Standards

SOFTWARE ENGINEER

  • Software Development: Hands on expertise in designing and building large enterprise applications using Java, C++ and Python.

  • Project Management: Skilled in managing multiple projects, leading cross functional teams, training and mentoring team members, and delivering critical projects using persuasive leadership style.

  • Data Analytics: Strong quantitative and analytical skills in analyzing large financial data sets using dynamic programming and R/C++.

  • Finance Industry Knowledge: Advanced knowledge about financial asset classes, risk management, referential data, FIX and exchange connectivity, and financial modeling using discounted cash flow and options pricing methods.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Societe General/Newedge Chicago, IL Associate Director October 2008 – Present • Managed and developed a data warehousing and business intelligence project that spans multiple financial asset classes such as Options, Futures, FX, OTC Commodities, Swaps, Repos and SLB. • Designed and developed a highly scalable trade routing system that facilitates straight through processing of trades and performs trade reconciliations to manage operational risk. • Wrote software to build a risk management system that computes VAR and performs stress test to manage credit and market risk. • Wrote software to build a credit limit monitoring systems to offer competitive cross margin rates to clients.

Technology Consultant Omaha/Indianapolis/Newark, USA Software Engineer/Project Manager November 1997 – October 2008 • Managed and developed software solutions for the following organizations: Qwest (Telecom), HomeAccount (Banking), UP and KAG (Logistics), Liberty Mutual and Guidewire (Insurance).

National Stock Exchange Mumbai, India Systems Officer September 1995 – October 1997 • Assisted in designing and developing an order driven equities trading platform.

EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATIONS CFA Institute, Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charter holder 2013 FINRA, National Commodities Futures (Series 3) 2009 Goa University, India – Bachelor of Computer Engineering 1994

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES • Expert Skills: Java, C++, Python, STL, Design Patterns, SDLC, FIX, Oracle, Gemfire, Tibco, IBM MQ and Rabbit MQ/AMQP, Excel/VBA. • Advanced Skills: R, Ruby, Matlab, SAS Enterprise Miner and Hadoop • Intermediate Skills: Quantitative finance, statistical analysis, time series analysis, financial and stochastic modeling.
